Author: hello_moto
Content: I would like to know more about the overall architecture especially with their backend written in C# rather than Ruby.

Author: sbraford
Content:
Yes, "investors" here is a bit broad.

Reading posts like this make it seem really pointless to spend too much time seeking investment.

Just go out and build a solid business. Either:

A) It will work. You will have profits and/or investors will be beating down your door.

B) It won't - you've run out of money and no one wants to invest in you. Just give up!

Luckily there are angels and groups like YC who don't take the "don't fund founder salaries" approach.

For a small web 2.0 startup -- server costs are around $100-500 a month for even a modestly successful app.

What else are investors funding, if not founder salaries??
